--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Weiming Yin <yinweiming@h...> wrote:
> I designed some interfaces about my application
> Now I want to write some unit test case for test these interfaces.
> But I have no concrete class, how can I write the test case. The 
> constructor is a problem.
> I can use Factory pattern to solve the problem.
> Is there any other method to build these cases?
> I don't want to so much FACTORY.

You don't write tests to an interface, you write tests to an
implementation.

If you have a number of implementations that you wish to test for
conformance to an interface contract, you could write a parameterised
test for this purpose; we've been discussing parameterised tests to
death in the last couple of days.

Robert.
